entry.title: Bug in key.cpp
entry.summary: In a discussion thread on the Bitcoin-development mailing list, a bug is identified in line 273 of the key.cpp file. The current if statement is using "rec=3" instead of "rec==3", which has caused confusion as 3 is a valid value. It was suggested that "return false" should be changed to "return true" to fix the bug. However, another participant points out that the value causing issues may not actually be 25%. They encourage further tinkering to find the root cause of the bug.Additionally, the email includes a promotional message about an upcoming event hosted by Perforce. The event promises expert tips and advice on migrating legacy SCM systems to improve productivity and software release efficiency.
